1050. Although the patient may recover, yet the powerful effort nature was required to make to over-come the poison, injured the constitution, and shortened the life of the patient. There are many who do not die under the influence of drugs, but there are 
                                                                           246
very many who are left useless wrecks, hopeless, gloomy, and miserable sufferers, a burden to themselves and to society.--H. to L., Chap. 3, p. 50.
